timeline.bodyText: As far as I know, there can be entries can appear more than once. For instance there can be multiple address entries if the address is more than one line. The OpenBMP-implementation concatenates these strings before persisting them. So, this is missing here.
timeline.author: christianpape

replies.bodyText: yeah, OpenBMP has this handling for RIPE. I m looking for an example AS number to properly implement this.  Currently all the responses I'm getting are from ARIN and RTT.
replies.author: cgorantla

replies.bodyText: I updated few things but still didn't get an example for having Address in multiple lines even with RIPE. We can address this later if we find such scenarios.
replies.author: cgorantla

replies.bodyText: @cgorantla https://www.ripe.net/manage-ips-and-asns/db/support/querying-the-ripe-database has some examples showing multiple address lines. What do you need for testing? Maybe I can provide something.
replies.author: fooker

replies.bodyText:
I was looking for an AS number that can give us output just like above example.
We need to split multiple address lines into  address, city,  state and country. I'm looking if there is any standard way to do that.
replies.author: cgorantla

replies.bodyText:
My understanding of the code above is that it will overwrite with the last encountered address value. Maybe it would be more suitable to concatenate the multiple lines separated by \n. Looks like that's what openbmp is doing: https://github.com/SNAS/openbmp-mysql-consumer/blob/master/cron_scripts/gen-whois/gen-whois-asn.py#L186 .
The reference code calls the whois command, which by default also fetches related entries. Maybe org.apache.commons.net.whois.WhoisClient does not do this?
whois -h whois.ripe.net AS8319 shows some output with multiple address lines.
This is not only true for the address field but for almost all fields (RIPE marks them as multiple in the link above).
replies.author: fooker

replies.bodyText: Removing optional a with the query a AS8319 seems to give the output identical to whois client.  Updated code to append multiple lines in address/remarks/orgId as per link above.
replies.author: cgorantla

replies.bodyText: @fooker  This is taken care with dc3c5b6.  Can you take a look
replies.author: cgorantla

timeline.message:
NMS-12963: Handle review comments

remove a for AS query.
Handle multiple lines in address/remarks/orgId

timeline.bodyText: Can we have a test for this?
timeline.author: fooker

replies.bodyText: Simplified this and added a test case for expected output.
replies.author: cgorantla

timeline.bodyText: This code path is never taken if i == 0 because asn will always be 0 on the first iteration.
timeline.author: fooker

timeline.bodyText:
Why not parse the ASNs into longs here? this would save some error handling in the loop.
By doing so, we can skip the whole update if the path in invalid.
timeline.author: fooker

timeline.bodyText:
The loop can be simplified by iterating from i = 1 to i = asnArray.length - . The  you can use i-1 and i+1 for left and right ASN inside the loop.
In addition, the Origin AS handling can be done out of loop at the end.
timeline.author: fooker
